intro: Tetranthera lucida, commonly known as the shining tetranthera, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Its leaves are sometimes used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits.
